title: Art Plunder-The Fate of Works of Art in War and Unrest
description:
Art Plunder: The Fate of Works of Art in War and Unrest
John Day | 1961 | English | 288 pages | PDF | 37 MB

Since earliest times, works of art have been looted, bartered, and requisitioned, as well as sold, sometimes in this way being carried halfway around the world. This book tells the remarkable story of the wanderings of many famous statues, paintings, and objects of art from Roman times until the present day. It is also an unusual and absorbing study of the changing attitudes toward the removal of art treasures in times of trouble
